intro: Rinorea giorgii, commonly known as the purple leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Rinorea giorgii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant leaves and delicate blooms. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
